result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett A. Lieberman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Brett A. Lieberman

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $3,143.35.   Pay restitution pursuant to schedule arrived at by the Dept of Corrections in working with the defendant. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain employment or schooling or combination equal to fulltime, keeping in mind that his primary responsibility is to pay restitution.
Complete psychological assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

No contact with Officer Andrew Hopfensperger, his family or place of employment except for a letter of apology if he wishes to write one and provide to agent to forward. 
Allowed contact if both the victim and the defendant are willing to participate in victim-offender conferencing.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Not enter any tavern, bar or other establisment whose primary source of income is the sale of alcohol.

Comply with any other assessment, treatment or programming recommended by the COMPAS assessment and agent thru DOC. 
Sign release of information forms for offender assessments, medication pharmacies and treatment
Pay all court ordered financial obligations on a schedule developed between him and the agent.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so.
Complete AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine and costs totaling $1,505.00.  To be paid within 60 days from release from custody in count 1.  Set up a payment plan if he cannot pay with that time.

Huber, if eligible, for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Count 1.

*Defendant Brett A. Lieberman in court with attorney Craig S. Powell. Attorney Louis Molepske and Shelly Rusch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Exhibits #1 thru #6 are marked on behalf of the plaintiff prior to the court case being called. 

1:49 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Rusch makes statements to the Court re: Sentencing Memorandum error. 
Exhibit #6 is offered by Atty Rusch.  

Court does not require the Court Reporter to transcribe the video clips as transcripts are provided. 

Exhibits #7 thru #11 are marked on behalf of the plaintiff. 
Atty Powell stipulates to the restitution amount as stated by Atty Molepske. 

Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court and provides evidence to the Court.
Exhibit #9 is played from 12:39 ending at 14:03.  
No objection by Atty Powell. 

Court questions Atty Molepske. 
Atty Powell plans to play a short video clip but will do so during the arguments. 

Victim makes statements to the Court. 

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Molepske files Victim Impact Statement with the Court. 
Atty Powell has received a copy of that statement. 
Court reviews the statement. 
Atty Molepske continues with sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Exhibit #7 is played starting at :0 and ending at :43.
Exhibit #8 is played starting at :0 and ending at :46.

Court questions Atty Molepske. 
Atty Powell makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Video is played without the audio. (This video is not identified by exhibit #)

Court questions parties re: credit. 
Atty Molepske makes statements re: credit. 

3:34 p.m.  Court takes a 5 minute recess. 

3:45 p.m.  Court is back in session.  Appearances remain the same. 

Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - 
Indeterminate prison sentence of 15 years with 10 years initial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision with 519 days credit:
No contact with Officer Andrew Hopfensperger, his family or place of employment except for a letter of apology if he wishes to write one and provide to agent to forward. 
Allowed contact if both the victim and the defendant are willing to participate in victim-offender conferencing.
Complete psychological assessment and comply with treatment recommendations. 
Complete AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Comply with any other assessment, treatment or programming recommended by the COMPAS assessment and agent thru DOC. 
Sign release of information forms for offender assessments, medication pharmacies and treatment
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Not enter any tavern, bar or other establisment whose primary source of income is the sale of alcohol.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations on a schedule developed between him and the agent.
Obtain and maintain employment or schooling or combination equal to fulltime, keeping in mind that his primary responsibility is to pay restitution. 
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so. 
Pay costs. 
Pay restitution in the amount of $3,143.35.

Court questions program eligibility. 
Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions Probation agent. 
Atty Powell makes statements to the Court.  

BY THE COURT:  Court does not find the defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration program or Substance Abuse program for the reasons stated on the record. 

Count 2 - (BAC .197)
Serve 22 days jail, consecutive to Count 1
Huber, if eligible, for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Pay fine and costs totaling $1,505.00. To be paid within 60 days from release from custody.  Set up a payment plan if he cannot pay within that time
15 months revocation
15 months IID
DOT Assessment and comply with the safety plan to reinstate. 

Court advises of 20 days post-conviction. 
Court provides the defendant with a copy of the Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

*Plea hearing at 10-26-2015 11:00 am
*Motion to Admit Specific Instances of Conduct Bearing on Truthfulness
*Jury Trial Witness List
*State's Notice of Expert Testimony
*State's
*State's Supplemental Motion in Limine

*Defendant Brett A. Lieberman in court with attorney Martin Kohler and Craig S Powell. Defendant Brett A. Lieberman in custody. Louis J. Molepske, David Knaapen and Shelly Rusch with the Attorney General's Office appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:37 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.
There are a number of Motions filed by the defense.
Atty Powell makes statement to the Court.
Atty Powell indicates that he will withdraw the motion in re:  State Destruction of Evidence.
Atty Powell states motion in regards to telephone issue and a way to remedy this issue.
Atty Powell would request an adjournment due to the new information received.
Atty Rusch makes statements regarding the jail calls and indicates that the defense had recently received a number of affidavits to attempt to remedy the issue. Atty Rusch indicates that there are tapes of phone calls from the defendant to others and that they would request that the numbers related to the defendants attorney be removed from the tapes to have all other calls just on the tapes.
Court questions how long this would take.
Atty Rusch indicates that they should be able to re-do the tapes within a week.
Atty Rusch makes additional statements regarding the phone call issue.
Court questions Atty Powell and he makes a statement; the state does not object to extending the date for the defense to file its motions to Septermber 25, 2015.
Court makes statements to the parties.
Court questions the defense if there has been any discussion with the jail and themselves to be able to provide an area for confidential phone conversations with his client.  
Court indicates that the defense should be able to confer with his client without other inmates listening.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding the phone calls.
BTC:  Motion (State Destruction of Evidence) filed by the defense on April 27, 2015 is to be withdrawn.
Atty Rusch makes a statment requesting that the witness lists be provided by September 25, 2015; clarified by the Court that this had been earlier indicated.
Atty Rusch makes statements regarding the dangerous weapon enhancer; would move the Court to Amend the Information to include the dangerous weapon enhancer.
Atty Powell reserves the right to look into this issue himself.
Court states that in regards to the Jury Instructions they be provided by September 25, 2015 by all parties.
Atty Molepske makes statements in regards to the Motions in Limine that had been filed.
Court has reviewed the proposed order and Atty Powell's response and makes statements.
Atty Powell makes statements; Court has further questions and Atty Molepske makes a statement.
Atty Rusch requests clarification from the Court in regards to the PTSD not being brought up in Trial; Court informs Atty Rusch to review the transcript.
Court makes statements that there would not be any telephonic testimony provided and the witness would need to appear in person.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding his witness.
Court has additional issues they would like to address and does so.
Atty Powell makes statements that they can discuss when witness list is due.
Court makes statements that the conflict with one of the witnesses has been resolved.
Court goes back to the issue that had arisen regarding the PTSD and addresses this issue with Atty Rusch.

BY THE COURT:
Court allows the issue on the phone calls to be adjourned.
Defense will have until 09/25/15 to file any additional motions.
All issues discussed today will need to be provided to the Court by September 25, 2015.
*of Jane Iwanski
*of Dale Boettcher
*of Louis J. Molepske Jr.
*of Cory Nelson
*of Tammy Shoemaker
*of David R. Knaapen
*of Holly Mrozinski
*of Counsel - S. Rusch
*States withdraws motion to amend the Information.
*Transcript of Motions in Limine held 7/17/15
*from DA to court re: copies of motions

*Defendant Brett A. Lieberman in court with attorney Craig S Powell Defendant Brett A. Lieberman in custody. Louis J. Molepske and David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:30 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.
Court has received a number of motions - 5 from the State and 3 from the Defendant.
Atty Powell makes a statement that there is another motion date in September and is ready to handle the states issues but not the defense issues today.
Atty Molepske makes statements as to how the additional motion hearing date was set in September.
Atty Molepske makes statements on his motion to amend; states this on the record.
Court makes statements to Atty Molepske; he responds to the Court's questioning regarding the BAC.  
Atty Molepske would like to handle the Notice issues and get those out of the way.
Atty Powell has no issue with the notices received (notice of intent to receive DNA evidence and one additional notice on experts).
Atty Molepske states that there will be a change in doctor's and will file a new notice on this.
Atty Molepske states his motion for responsibility examination under section 971.16(2).
Atty Powell does object to this motion.
Atty Molepske makes statements on the record.
Court questions Atty Molepske if he is still requesting a Court order for an examination; Atty Molepske makes statements.
Atty Powell makes statements in regards to the exam as requested by Atty Molepske.
Court makes statements to all parties in regards to the relevance of an examination since this is almost 11 months old.
Atty Molepske makes statements in regards to his Motions in Limine. 
Atty Molepske will now be heard on his Motion in Limine filed on April 27, 2015.
Court retrieves the Motion from the case and has reviewed. 
Court goes over the Motion in Limine and goes over each individual one and this information is stated on the record.  There are 21 pre-trial ruling's on the Motion in Limine.
Atty Molepske makes a statement on #4 on the Motion in Limine and Atty Powell is allowed to respond to #4.
**court finds that the conviction is not available for impeachment purposes
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding the Court's ruling on #4 of the Motion in Limine.
Court continues going through the Motion in Limine.
Atty Molepske makes a statement on #9 and is requesting a deadline to further define it; Atty Powell makes a statement.
BTC:  All disclosure on any additional witnesses or evidence to be provided by September 25, 2015 and this is set for both parties.
Court makes a statement regarding "good cause" on #11 of the Motion in Limine in regards to James Bielenda appearing via telephone.
Atty Molepske makes statements in regards to withholding ruling on James Bielenda appearing by telephone.
BTC:  Court will not grant the motion, at this time, on #11 of the Motion in Limine.
Atty Molepske makes statements on #12 of the Motion in Limine - if Atty Molepske would like the Court to make a ruling he will have to file a motion and itemize those statements.  Will need to review this with counsel.
Atty Molepske makes statements on #13 of the Motion in Limine; Atty Powell has no objection and makes statements as this is a general rule.
BTC:  Court agree's with Atty Powell and states that this is a general rule of the law and will not make a specific ruling but is in agreement with the general statement on #13.  If comes up at trial a proper foundation will have to be laid.
Atty Molepske does not have a concern on #14 at this time; will raise it later if it becomes an issue.
Atty Molepske makes a statement on #16 of Motion in Limine; Atty Powell in in agreement.
Neither party objects to #17 of the Motion in Limine.
Atty Molepske makes statements on #18 of the Motion in Limine; Atty Powell responds to the statement of Atty Molepske.
Court is in agreement that the defendant cannot claim NGI as this is not an NGI case and makes additional statements on the record.
Atty Molepske makes statements on #21 of the Motion in Limine; Atty Powell responds to Atty Molepske's statement.
Court would like Atty Powell to elaborate on his previous statement and he does so on the record.
BTC:  Court will not allow testimony along the lines that the defendant has PTSD; Court would need to be offered evidence and this would need to be offered prior to Trial.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding Mr Bielenda appearing by phone but would ask if Atty Powell would object to Mr Bielenda appearing via video.
Atty Powell will need to take time to discuss that issue with his client.
Atty Powell makes statements on Motion filed on July 16, 2015; Atty Molepske responds to the statement of Atty Powell.
BTC:  Difficult to make a ruling on this motion in advance and will not rule one way or the other.  Evidence must be relevant.  Court will decline to rule on this motion. 
Motion to Amend Information is final Motion to be reviewed.
Atty Molepske states that this will have to be by oral motion as not specifically stated in his motion and this is stated on the record.
Court questions Atty Molepske if he is withdrawing his motion to amend information.
Atty Molepske makes addtional statement; Court states that this will come in if it is relevant.
State will withdraw the motion to amend information at this time.
Court questions Atty Molepske when he will add this charge (as stated on the record) as the defense has the right to know to be able to prepare for trial.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding #4 on his Motion in Limine.  Court makes statements to Atty Molepske.
Court questions when the State will have a decision made; Atty Powell states by July 31, 2015 to make decision is okay.
BTC:  Atty Molepske has until July 31, 2015 to make his decision on charge.
Court makes statements regarding a possible adjournment of this trial do to a conflict by another party involved in another case.  This will be heard in the future if it becomes an issue.
Atty Molepske makes statements regarding an "Order to Seal Document" and would like a little understanding as to why this is sealed.
Court makes statement to Atty Molepske and if he would like additional information Atty Molepske can question the defense counsel.
Atty Powell does not have a statement regarding the sealed document.
Parties have nothing further to offer for today's hearing.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not order an examination under 971.16(2).
State to draft an order regarding today's hearing.

2:33 p.m.  Court is in recess.

Defendant Brett A. Lieberman in court with attorney Craig S Powell and attorney Martin E Kohler. Defendant Brett A. Lieberman in CUSTODY. Louis J Molepske, Jr. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:44 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.
David Forsythe is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Molepske.
1:49 p.m.  Objection by Attorney Geoffrey R Powell (foundation); State informed to re-word.
2nd objection; sustained.
Atty Powell would like the record to reflect the motion made by David Forsythe as a stabbing motion; the record shall so reflect.
2:02 p.m.  Objection by Atty Powell (speculation); sustained.
Objection by Atty Powell (relevance); overruled.
Witness identifies the defendant.  BTC:  record should reflect that the witness has identified the defendant.
2:07 p.m.  Cross examiniation by Atty Powell.
2:11 p.m.  Objection by Atty Molepske; sustained.
2:12 p.m.  Objection by Atty Molepske; overruled.
2nd objection (beyond the scope of the direct/preliminary hearing); sustained.
2:16 p.m.  Objection by Atty Molepske (beyond the scope of direct); sustained.
2:17 p.m.  Objection by Atty Molepske (beyond the scope of direct); sustained (2).
2:19 p.m.  Objection by Atty Molepske; Atty Powell is just trying to clarify statement made; overruled.
2nd Objection (relevance); sustained.
2:20 p.m.  Re-direct by Atty Molepske.
2:22 p.m.  Re-Cross by Atty Misfeldt.
Objection by Atty Molepske; sustained.
Witness is excused.
2:23 p.m.  Atty Molepske gives his argument.
2:24 p.m.  Atty Powell does not give any argument.

Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

Atty Misfeldt makes arguments in regards to the bond.  Makes additional statements in regards to defendant's medication. Asks that the defendant be given the opportunity to take all medications.
